newInstance

java.lang.Object newInstance()
Creates a new instance of the class represented by this RttiClass object. The class is instantiated as if by a new expression with an empty argument list. If the constructor isn't available null is returned.

Returns:

assign

boolean assign(java.lang.Object dest,
               java.lang.Object source)
Assigns all visible fields from one object to another. Note that destination and source classes must share same superclass (whose fields will be assigned if it has RTTI generated). Assignment of completely anonymous classes is not supported.

Parameters:
dest -
source - source must be of type E (or descendant)
Returns:
true if the object was successfully assigned

compare

boolean compare(java.lang.Object to,
                java.lang.Object from)
Compare all visible fields of one object to another. Note that destination and source classes must be the same. Object fields are compared either using compare if they implement Comparable interface or equals otherwise. Read-only fields are compared also.

Parameters:
to -
from - from must be of type E
Returns:
true if the object are equal

RttiField getField(java.lang.String name)
Returns field with given name. If not found returns null.

getMethods

RttiMethod[] getMethods()
Returns list of all public methods or empty array if there are none. If method generation is turned off for this type it returns null.

Returns:

getMethod

RttiMethod getMethod(java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.Class<?>... paramTypes)
Returns method with given name. If not found returns null.

getEnumConstants

<T> T[] getEnumConstants(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
Returns the elements of this enum class or null if this Class object does not represent an enum type. This is type-safe variant

Parameters:
clazz - Possible return parameter (should be the same as
Returns:
an array containing the values comprising the enum class represented by this Class object in the order they're declared, or null if this Class object does not represent an enum type
Throws:
java.lang.ClassCastException - it enum is of different type

getEnumConstants

<T> T[] getEnumConstants()
Returns the elements of this enum class or null if this Class object does not represent an enum type.

Returns:
an array containing the values comprising the enum class represented by this Class object in the order they're declared, or null if this Class object does not represent an enum type

getAnnotations

java.lang.annotation.Annotation[] getAnnotations()
Returns any annotations specified on the field or empty array if there are none (note that RTTI and JAVA specific annotations are striped away.

Returns:
